sentences.sContent: Researchers were given a £10,000 grant to continue their work.
sentences.sCn: 研究人员得到一万英镑的经费以继续他们的研究。

sentences.sContent: I’ve got some old diaries that my grandmother gave me years ago.
sentences.sCn: 我有几本旧日记本，是多年前祖母给我的。

sentences.sContent: I didn’t steal it! Maria gave it to me!
sentences.sCn: 我不是偷的！是玛丽亚给我的！

sentences.sContent: Most people are willing to give to charity .
sentences.sCn: 大多数人都愿意向慈善事业捐款。

sentences.sContent: The situation is now desperate, so please give generously .
sentences.sCn: 现在情况危急，请大家慷慨解囊。

sentences.sContent: ...and began to test her: he would give her a date and ask her to tell him about the world events on that day...

...finds that the best way to ensure employees are “engaged” is to give them more control over where and how they do their work―which may mean liberating them from having to do everything in collaboration with others...
...which give many a modem beer its bitter flavor...
...What advice would Leah give you to move you ahead on your journey...
...it is advisable to give them more flexibility as to where and how they work...
...and he will give you the details of the weather...
...Most professors agree whether to give an in-class or a take-home exam depends on type of course being taught...
...Google can give us the powerful illusion that all questions have definite answers...
...he quotes Google co-founder Larry Page to the effect that the perfect search engine will understand exactly what I mean and give me back exactly what I want...

synos.tran: 捐赠；面向；有弹性；气候转暖

phrases.pCn: 分发，发出；公布，发表；用尽，精疲力竭
增减……而无大变化；允许有小误差
牺牲自己的时间和精力；腾出时间和力量来帮助别人
放弃；对…表示绝望；对…不再期待

words.tran: 给；赠送（give的ing形式）；付出；产生

trans.tranOther: to let someone have something as a present, or to provide something for someone
